urn:contentItem:60T0-J841-JB4F-Y235-00000-00September 08, 2020: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Recognized Among the 2020 "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother2020-09-09T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:24:31ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSSeptember 08, 2020: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Recognized Among the 2020 "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother

Holland & Hart is proud to announce that for the tenth time it has been honored as one of the "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother. As a firm that has been recognized ten times or more, the firm also earns designation on Working Mother's Hall of Fame.

The list of Best Law Firms for Working Mothers, which has been published for 13 years, showcases law firms' efforts and successes in finding, retaining, promoting, and developing women lawyers. The 2020 Working Mother Best Law Firms for Women application, administered by the Working Mother Research Institute, included more than 300 questions about attorney demographics at different levels, schedule flexibility, paid time off and parental leaves, and development and retention of women.

Subra Barry, president of Working Mother Media noted, "Law firms on this year's list were better prepared to respond to the effects of the pandemic because of their continued support of flextime and remote work for working parents and caregivers. We are proud to recognize their resilience and steadfast commitment to supporting gender equality." All the firms on the 2020 list offer reduced hours and remote work for lawyers and this year's research found 39% of female lawyers used remote work in 2019.

Holland & Hart has long been in the vanguard of supporting the success of women attorneys. An early-adopter of a formalized policy that enables lawyers to work on a reduced time basis, the firm's first female reduced-time attorney took advantage of this opportunity almost 30 years ago. Holland & Hart was also one of the first law firms in its region to adopt a maternity leave policy in the 1980's, providing up to six months of leave (some paid, some unpaid)-practically unheard of at the time.

Earlier this year, Holland & Hart also received U.S. Gold Standard Certification from the Women in Law Empowerment Forum (WILEF) for the tenth consecutive year, being one of only 12 firms to receive this recognition every year since WILEF began the award in 2011. The firm was also ranked tenth on the 2020 A-List: Female Equity Partner Scorecard by The American Lawyer.

INDEX

SECTION 1 HOLLAND & HART PROFILE

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 4 HOLLAND & HART TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 HOLLAND & HART PROFILE

1.1 ACTIVITIES

Holland & Hart helps clients with integrated legal solutions. We work with regional, national, and international clients of all sizes to tackle virtually any kind of legal issue. We help our clients ascend, whatever the "mountain" they face. Established in 1947, Holland & Hart today has more than 470 lawyers providing a full range of services from 15 offices across the Mountain West and in Washington, D.C. Our value proposition is to provide our clients in the region and beyond with the breadth and depth of experience to enable them to meet their business objectives. We offer a client-driven culture with service that is personalized, responsive, and innovative.

1.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4297276604

Website: https://www.hollandhart.com/

Industry: LAW

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

September 01: Holland & Hart: Two Holland & Hart Attorneys Named Leading U.S. Bankruptcy & Restructuring Lawyers by Lawdragon

Holland & Hart is proud to announce that Boise-based partner Larry Prince and Denver-based partner Risa Wolf-Smith have been named to the inaugural Lawdragon 500 Leading U.S. Bankruptcy & Restructuring Lawyers guide.

The guide highlights lawyers who "bring remarkable skills in financing, structuring, litigating and creating a pathway forward." Honorees were selected through submissions, journalistic research and editorial vetting from a board of peers and clients.

Holland & Hart's Bankruptcy, Restructuring, and Creditors' Rights practice encompassing virtually everything that may flow from financial distress faced by our clients or those they deal with. Our lawyers have extensive experience in all phases of bankruptcy and insolvency. Among the many things we do is bankruptcy litigation, including avoidance actions, stay relief, adequate protection, plan confirmation, dischargeability, dismissal/conversion, and claim disputes, as well as contract and commercial litigation in the bankruptcy context.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Holland & Hart: Paul Swanson Discusses Antitrust Laws in the Gaming Industry Following Epic Games' Lawsuit Against Apple and Google

Holland & Hart antitrust and litigation attorney Paul Swanson shares insights with several media outlets into the review and decisions around antitrust violations in the gaming industry following Epic Games' lawsuit against Apple and Google. He provides a practitioner's perspective by calling the latest decision that Apple could not block Epic Games from accessing its developer tools, "a 'reasonable middle course' that reserves the status quo while saving bigger issues around anticompetitive business practices for 'another day.'"

Source: Company Website

July 29: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Advises Vaporsens in its Acquisition by Gentex Corporation

Holland & Hart represented Vaporsens, Inc. (Vaporsens), a Utah-based technology company specializing in nanofiber chemical sensing research and development, in its recent acquisition by Gentex Corporation (Gentex). Gentex purchased all of Vaporsens' stock for $10.5 million, which was in addition to its previous $3 million equity investment in Vaporsens. Gentex is a technology company, proficient in a wide range of core competencies that yield a unique fusion of technologies. The transaction closed on April 8, 2020.

Gentex funded the acquisition with $7.1 million in cash payments, with the remaining $3.4 million of consideration paid with restricted common stock of Gentex. The acquisition of Vaporsens will enable Gentex to complement and expand its product offerings.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised Vaporsens on the transaction, led by partner Jeff Steele with assistance from core team members associate Scott Baird and summer clerk Rossetti Farrell. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from Nathan Archibald, Sanna Deerrose, Shaun Kennedy, Mark Langer, John Ludlum, Sara Shelly, Lindsay Silber, and Trent Timmons.

Source: Company Website

July 23: Holland & Hart: Denver-area attorneys see uptick in design patent infringement

With businesses pivoting to sell more online, counterfeiters are better able to push fake products. That's where design patent protection can help.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Advises Innergex Renewable Energy in its Acquisition of Six Idaho Wind Farms

Holland & Hart represented Innergex Renewable Energy Inc. ("Innergex") in its acquisition of the sponsor interest in a portfolio of six operating wind farms in Elmore County, Idaho (the "Mountain Air Acquisition") for a purchase price of $56.8 million from Terna Energy SA. The portfolio's tax equity partner is insurer MetLife. Innergex is an independent renewable power producer that develops, acquires, owns, and operates hydroelectric facilities, wind farms, and solar farms in Canada, the United States, France, and Chile.

The Mountain Air Acquisition comprises six 23 MW wind farms-Cold Springs, Desert Meadow, Hammett Hill, Mainline, Ryegrass, and Two Ponds-with a total installed capacity of 138 MW and is expected to produce a gross estimated long-term average of 331  GWh per year. The six wind farms have power purchase agreements with Idaho Power Company. This strategic acquisition further expands Innergex's portfolio in the U.S.

Holland & Hart's transactional team was led by Billi McCullough and Linda Jones and included Nneka Obiokoye, Adam Cohen, Arthur Hundhausen, Alison Hunter, Amy Lovin, Thor Nelson, Austin Rueschhoff, and Hilary Vaughn.

Holland & Hart's renewable energy team leverages decades of power industry experience to help clients seize opportunities to produce, develop, generate, and move electric power. We counsel clients on complex transactions and projects generating energy through solar, wind, geothermal, hydroelectric, and biofuels, as well as energy storage.

Source: Company Website

July 14: Holland & Hart: Public Hearing Begins Into "Unusual" Investigation Of Pacificorp's Energy Roadmap

The Wyoming Public Service Commission (PSC) has begun a week-long hearing regarding its investigation into a western utility's 20-year Integrated Resource Plan (IRP) released in October, 2019.

The preferred portfolio would retire several coal plant units in Wyoming along with New Mexico and Montana. It would then develop significant solar, wind, and battery storage resources throughout the region.

Source: Company Website

June 26: Holland & Hart: PG&E launches $5.2B in public offerings, targets July bankruptcy exit following judge's order

Update: June 26, 2020: PG&E announced June 26 that it has priced the public offering of 423,372,629 shares of its common stock at $9.50 per share and 14,545,455 of its equity units at $100 per unit "for total net proceeds to the Corporation, before estimated offering expenses, of approximately $3.968 billion and approximately $1.186 billion, respectively." PG&E said the offerings are expected to close on July 1, subject to certain conditions, the same date it expects to emerge from Chapter 11.

Source: Company Website

June 26: Holland & Hart Recognized for High-Quality Patent Scores at the USPTO by Patent Bots

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce it has been recognized as a top-ranking firm in the 2020 Patent Bots Quality Scores report. The report is a listing of law firms with at least 50 issued patents for the year ending March 31, 2020.

During the reporting year, Holland & Hart ranked 5th out of 284 firms in the Patent Bots Quality Scores for USPTO Tech Center 2800 (Semiconductors/Memory, Circuits/Measuring and Testing, Optics/Photocopying, Printing/Measuring and Testing), with an average score of 96.98 across 164 issued patents. The firm also ranked 7th out of 163 firms in the Patent Bots Quality Scores for USPTO Tech Center 2400 (Networking, Multiplexing, Cable, and Security), with an average score of 94.88 out of 278 issued patents.

Scores are calculated using an automated patent proofreading process that counts the number of errors in each issued patent downloaded from the USPTO for the year. Although the precise error counts in any individual patent may not be accurate, the average number of errors across all of a firm's patents is an excellent indicator of the quality of a firm's work.

Holland & Hart's team of 60+ patent attorneys, agents, and engineers provide strategic advice on high-value, high-volume patent portfolio development, counselling, and opinion matters for clients with large portfolios and/or complex technology or processes, drawing on our legal, practical, and technical experience. Our patent practice primarily focuses on next-gen technologies, including electrical engineering, wireless communications, computer technologies, software, semiconductors, physics, mechanical engineering, robotics, complex medical devices, chemical engineering, biotech, pharmaceutical, and other life sciences technologies.

Source: Company Website

June 23: Ten Holland & Hart Attorneys Recognized as 2020 IP Stars by Managing Intellectual Property

Managing Intellectual Property, an annual guide ranking the world's leading IP firms and practitioners, has recognized ten IP attorneys as 2020 IP STARS as well as the firm's IP practice nationally in the U.S. for trademark prosecution. Holland & Hart's IP practice was also ranked as highly recommended in Colorado and recommended in Idaho, Montana, and Utah.

Source: Company Website

June 05: Holland & Hart: Deep Space Systems Finalizes Acquisition by AE Industrial Partners

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based aerospace firm Deep Space Systems, Inc. (DSS) in connection with its acquisition by private equity firm AE Industrial Partners, LP (AEI). DSS is a leader in space systems engineering supporting the design, development, integration, testing, and operations of science, technology, and exploration spacecraft. AEI specializes in aerospace, defense & government services, power generation, and specialty industrial markets. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

The transaction will enable AEI to combine DSS with Adcole Space to form Redwire, a next- generation space technology platform focused on designing and developing mission critical systems and high reliability electronics in support of innovative space architecture. Redwire will combine the capabilities of both DSS and Adcole Space to form a unique and exciting participant in the rapidly growing space industry.

Holland & Hart's M&A was led by attorneys Shaun Kennedy and Amos Barclay, with assistance from core team members Paige Coriden, Peter Perla, and Trent Timmons. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from 11 other attorneys and professionals. Source: Company Website

April 07: Holland & Hart Represents Destination Pet in its Acquisition of VitalPet

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based Destination Pet, a leading pet healthcare and services company, in connection with its acquisition of Veterinary Care Inc. (d/b/a "VitalPet"), through an auction in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Houston, Texas. VitalPet is a group of 24 high-quality veterinary hospitals operating across seven states spanning from Texas to New York, specializing in providing best-in-class veterinary medicine to local communities.

The acquisition expands Destination Pet's footprint and enhances its network of high-quality veterinary care and integrated extending services that are focused on the total health and wellbeing of the pet.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised Destination Pet on the transaction, led by attorneys Gabe Hamilton and Claire Rosston, with assistance from core team members Steve Clayton, Craig Dammeier, Daniel Free, Chris Groll, A.J. Martinez, and Grace Witsil. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from 20 other attorneys and professionals.

Source: Company Website

March 26: Holland & Hart: Alaska Governor Appoints Sean Parnell to the Alaska Economic Stabilization Team

Holland & Hart Of Counsel Sean Parnell was appointed to the Alaska Economic Stabilization Team (AEST) by Alaska Governor Mike Dunleavy. Sean Parnell and former US Senator Mark Begich are leading a bipartisan, non-political effort to better protect the state's economy from the impact of the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Alaska. The team is reaching out to businesses and communities in all economic sectors to gain information and devise strategies to address economic stabilization. That information is being passed to the Office of the Governor and will be informing the governor's and legislators' decisions in the days and weeks ahead.

AEST is innovating in a virtual team environment connecting via video conference and teleconference and creating a hub and spoke concept for Alaskans to communicate more information to decisionmakers. Each Alaskan becomes a "hub" and reaches out to their contacts in their own business sector to gain information and strategies for decision-makers to consider. The hub passes information directly to Sean Parnell and Mark Begich who compile the information, strategically connect dots with existing policy initiatives at the state, federal, and local levels, and convey that information to the attention of decision-makers. AEST is working closely with the Office of the Governor and legislators, and is augmenting the state's comprehensive response to COVID-19.

Sean Parnell leverages more than 30 years of public service and legal expertise serving the business, regulatory, and infrastructure development needs of the companies that drive Alaska's economy. During his years of service as Alaska's Governor, Lieutenant Governor, and as a state Senator and Representative, as well as the Deputy Director of the Department of Natural Resources, Division of Oil and Gas, Sean developed a thorough understanding of all aspects of commercial development in Alaska.

March 25: Holland & Hart: Matt Harvey Honored as one of Idaho Business Review's 2020 Accomplished Under 40

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce Matt Harvey, an associate in the firm's Boise office, has been selected as one of Idaho Business Review's 2020 Accomplished Under 40 honorees. The program recognizes business professionals under the age of 40 for their leadership, professional accomplishments, community support, and vision/meeting goals. The honorees come from diverse backgrounds and industries, including business, healthcare, law, nonprofit work, government, and academia. Matt was recognized for his work growing and leading a local team of patent professionals to serve both local and global clients.

Matt is a registered patent attorney and focuses on patent prosecution, patent analysis, and intellectual property due diligence matters across electrical engineering and other computer-related fields, including standards-essential technologies. Prior to joining Holland & Hart, Matt practiced as a litigator with an international law firm in Denver and as a patent agent in Silicon Valley. He also worked as an electrical engineer for the U.S. Department of Energy at Sandia National Laboratories and as a graduate researcher in the Wireless Sensing Lab at the University of Washington.

Source: Company Website

March 17: Holland & Hart Launches Coronavirus Resource Site

Holland & Hart's Coronavirus Task Force, a multidisciplinary team of experienced practitioners across the firm, developed a Coronavirus Resource Site that offers practical guidelines and proactive solutions to help companies protect their business interests and their greatest asset - their workforce. The Resource Site includes insights and other informational resources to identify questions and address challenges so businesses can manage the legal, human, and safety threats of COVID-19.

Source: Company Website

February 20: Holland & Hart : EnergyIQ Finalizes Strategic Acquisition by Quorum Driving Workflow Automation

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based EnergyIQ, LLC (EnergyIQ), a leading provider of well master data management software applications, in connection with its acquisition by Quorum Software (Quorum), the leader in digital transformation for the oil and gas industry. The acquisition expands and strengthens Quorum's industry-leading oil and gas software and services portfolio with EnergyIQ's leading well lifecycle data management for upstream exploration and production (E&P) companies. Financial details of the acquisition were not disclosed.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised EnergyIQ on the transaction, led by partner Sue Oakes, with assistance from M&A associates Ryan Nichols and Nate Davis and paralegal Sara Shelly. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from Hector Beason, Sanna Deerrose, Daniel Free, Ben Gibbons, Dave Glynn, Peter Perla, Kevin Selzer, Lindsay Silber, and Trent Timmons, among others.

Source: Company Website

February 03: Holland & Hart: Kate Bradshaw Honored as one of Utah Business Magazine's Forty Under 40

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce Kate Bradshaw, Director of Government Affairs in the firm's Salt Lake City office, has been selected as one of Utah Business Magazine's Forty Under 40 honorees. The program recognizes business professionals under the age of 40 for their business success in one or more of the following categories: demonstrating exceptional leadership qualities; an innovator creating a disrupted technology who is making a major impact in an industry or market; or an entrepreneur who has created a new market or industry for a product with a high level of success.

Kate is an influential and effective lobbyist in Utah. As Director of Government Affairs at Holland & Hart, she leads the firm's government affairs programs in eight western states and represents clients before the Utah State Legislature, Governor and Executive branch agencies, and local jurisdictions. Kate develops comprehensive legislative and public relations strategies, including community outreach, and advises on key legislative, PAC, and campaign donation strategies.

Kate is known for taking on challenging legislative topics. Just one example is the Responsible Beer Choice Coalition, where she crafted and led the grassroots and political lobbying effort to persuade the State Legislature to increase the alcohol content of beer sold in retail outlets in Utah from 3.2 to 4.0% alcohol by weight, representing the biggest change in Utah alcohol content laws in 86 years.

In addition to serving as Director of Government Affairs, Kate has held multiple leadership roles, including serving as Councilwoman to the City of Bountiful since 2018, chairing the Westminster College Alumni Board, forming the Utah Business Coalition in 2014 and serving as co-chair since 2017, and serving as precinct chair for Bountiful Precinct 9.

Kate will be honored at the Utah Business Forty Under 40 celebration on February 20.

January 09: Holland & Hart: Micro Gaming Technologies Finalizes Strategic Acquisition by Everi Expanding Loyalty and Marketing Technology

Holland & Hart represented Las Vegas-based Micro Gaming Technologies Inc. (MGT), a privately-owned provider of self-service casino loyalty and marketing products and promotional tools and apps, in connection with the acquisition of certain MGT strategic assets by Everi Payments Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Everi Holdings Inc., a premier single-source provider of gaming products, financial technology, and player loyalty solutions in the gaming industry. The acquisition enables Everi to enhance its loyalty and marketing products by expanding its FinTech products and services portfolio.

Reno partner David Garcia led Holland & Hart's M&A team advising MGT on the transaction, which included Lori Argall, Adam Cohen, law clerk Dmetri Culkar, Sanna Deerrose, John Ludlum, Christopher Myers, Lindsay Silber, Trent Timmons, and Elliot Weiss, among others.

Source: Company Website

January 03: Holland & Hart Receives Pro Bono Award by Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada

Holland & Hart is proud to announce it received the 2019 Lied Award for most pro bono hours donated by a law firm by Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada. Lied Awards are given in recognition of the Lied Foundation Trust, recognizing firms and individuals who excelled in their pro bono efforts. The award was presented at the 19th Annual Pro Bono Awards ceremony in December.

The firm's Las Vegas office was recognized for donating more than 1500 hours of pro bono legal services over the past year to individuals, non-profits, and other Nevada organizations, including providing counsel to the Volunteers in Medicine of Southern Nevada free clinic; Children's Attorneys Project, that offers advice and representation to abused and neglected foster care children; immigration cases; consumer cases; and participating in the Ask-A-Lawyer program and counseling, to name a few.

Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada commented online that Holland & Hart "consistently makes pro bono an integral part of their culture and identity." They added on Facebook, [b]ased on the number of attorneys in this office, this firm far exceeded Nevada's aspirational goal of 20 pro bono hours per attorney, per year. Holland & Hart is well deserving of the 2019 Lied Award for Most Pro Bono Hours by a Law Firm."

The following attorneys in the firm's Las Vegas office were included in the 100 Hours Club, for providing more than 100 hours of pro bono legal services throughout the past year:

Connie Akridge, partner - healthcare Gian Brown, partner - corporate Robert Cassity, partner - commercial litigation Sydney Gambee, associate - commercial litigation Christopher Myers, associate - corporate Michael Wadley, associate - real estate and construction

The following Las Vegas attorneys were included in the 50 Hours Club listing, for their commitment of providing more than 50 hours of pro bono legal services over the past year:

Matthew Cecil, of counsel - labor and employment Lars Evensen, partner - construction and bankruptcy Amber Lunn, associate - real estate and construction Jessica Whelan, associate - commercial litigation

Additionally, ten attorneys in the firm's Las Vegas office were recognized in the Honor Roll listing for accepting a new pro bono case, having an open pro bono case, mentored on a pro bono case, or reported hours on a colleague's pro bono case.

The Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada is a nonprofit law firm dedicated to providing direct legal representation, counsel and advice and community legal education to those who cannot afford an attorney.

January 01: Fifteen Attorneys Elected to Holland & Hart's Partnership

Holland & Hart LLP is pleased to announce that fifteen attorneys have been elected into the firm's partnership, effective Jan. 1. The newly elected partners serve clients in a range of practice areas and industries and work from several offices in the firm's footprint that includes eight states and Washington, D.C.

"Each of our new partners has achieved a level of preeminence in their practice areas to earn the trust and respect of clients," said Chris Balch, firm chair. "They have each demonstrated a commitment to the firm's core values, including teamwork, innovation, excellence, and diversity and inclusion that are critical to the firm's continued success " added Balch. Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2020

September 08: Holland & Hart: Joe Ramirez Elected Fellow of American College of Coverage Counsel

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce that Joe Ramirez, partner in the firm's Denver office, has been elected as a Fellow in the American College of Coverage Counsel (ACCC) by the ACCC Board of Regents. Established in 2012, the ACCC is a professional association comprised of U.S. and Canadian experienced and recognized lawyers in coverage and extracontractual matters who represent insurers and policyholders, and Honorary members from academia. Fellows are distinguished for their skill, experience, and high standards of professional and ethical conduct in the practice of insurance coverage and extracontractual law, and who are dedicated to excellence in this area of practice.

"We congratulate Joe on his fellowship in the American College of Coverage Counsel. We are proud of his accomplishments as a leader in insurance coverage law that earned him this well-deserved recognition," said Matt Smith, the firm's Commercial Litigation Practice Group Leader.

The ACCC focuses on educating all sectors involved in the field of insurance law - including the judiciary, legal and insurance professionals, law students and businesses - on cutting edge, emerging, and critical issues such as developing trends in insurance law and bad faith, trial practice and alternative dispute resolution, policy formation and claims handling.

Recognized as a leading insurance coverage lawyer, Joe provides clear strategies to his clients when they are faced with risk management and insurance coverage issues.

September 04: Holland & Hart: Google could face antitrust charges from Justice Department this month

An antitrust case against Google is coming as soon as this month.

Justice Department officials have pressured attorneys working on the case to wrap things up quickly so that an action can be brought against Alphabet Inc. GOOGL, -3.64% GOOG, -3.68%, the parent company of Google and YouTube, multiple sources told the New York Times on Thursday. MarketWatch was able to independently confirm the timing of the antitrust action.

A Justice Department spokeswoman declined to comment on the Times report. A company spokesman said Google would "continue to engage with ongoing investigations" and that its business practices enabled "increased choice and competition."

Google shares were flat in after-hours trading on Thursday.

The reasoning behind a rush to action underscores a belief among some antitrust experts that the Trump administration is seeking punitive measures against Big Tech for its influence over consumers and multiple markets to curry favor with voters. Anger toward the largest tech companies has resonated across political parties, from liberals to conservatives.

But some questioned the swift timetable, which could ultimately wreak havoc on a stock market driven by tech companies.

urn:contentItem:60T0-J841-JB4F-Y234-00000-00September 08, 2020: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Recognized Among the 2020 "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother2020-09-09T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:24:31ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSSeptember 08, 2020: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Recognized Among the 2020 "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother

Holland & Hart is proud to announce that for the tenth time it has been honored as one of the "Best Law Firms for Women" by Working Mother. As a firm that has been recognized ten times or more, the firm also earns designation on Working Mother's Hall of Fame.

The list of Best Law Firms for Working Mothers, which has been published for 13 years, showcases law firms' efforts and successes in finding, retaining, promoting, and developing women lawyers. The 2020 Working Mother Best Law Firms for Women application, administered by the Working Mother Research Institute, included more than 300 questions about attorney demographics at different levels, schedule flexibility, paid time off and parental leaves, and development and retention of women.

Subra Barry, president of Working Mother Media noted, "Law firms on this year's list were better prepared to respond to the effects of the pandemic because of their continued support of flextime and remote work for working parents and caregivers. We are proud to recognize their resilience and steadfast commitment to supporting gender equality." All the firms on the 2020 list offer reduced hours and remote work for lawyers and this year's research found 39% of female lawyers used remote work in 2019.

Holland & Hart has long been in the vanguard of supporting the success of women attorneys. An early-adopter of a formalized policy that enables lawyers to work on a reduced time basis, the firm's first female reduced-time attorney took advantage of this opportunity almost 30 years ago. Holland & Hart was also one of the first law firms in its region to adopt a maternity leave policy in the 1980's, providing up to six months of leave (some paid, some unpaid)-practically unheard of at the time.

Earlier this year, Holland & Hart also received U.S. Gold Standard Certification from the Women in Law Empowerment Forum (WILEF) for the tenth consecutive year, being one of only 12 firms to receive this recognition every year since WILEF began the award in 2011. The firm was also ranked tenth on the 2020 A-List: Female Equity Partner Scorecard by The American Lawyer.

INDEX

SECTION 1 HOLLAND & HART PROFILE

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 4 HOLLAND & HART TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 HOLLAND & HART PROFILE

1.1 ACTIVITIES

Holland & Hart helps clients with integrated legal solutions. We work with regional, national, and international clients of all sizes to tackle virtually any kind of legal issue. We help our clients ascend, whatever the "mountain" they face. Established in 1947, Holland & Hart today has more than 470 lawyers providing a full range of services from 15 offices across the Mountain West and in Washington, D.C. Our value proposition is to provide our clients in the region and beyond with the breadth and depth of experience to enable them to meet their business objectives. We offer a client-driven culture with service that is personalized, responsive, and innovative.

1.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4297276604

Website: https://www.hollandhart.com/

Industry: LAW

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

September 01: Holland & Hart: Two Holland & Hart Attorneys Named Leading U.S. Bankruptcy & Restructuring Lawyers by Lawdragon

Holland & Hart is proud to announce that Boise-based partner Larry Prince and Denver-based partner Risa Wolf-Smith have been named to the inaugural Lawdragon 500 Leading U.S. Bankruptcy & Restructuring Lawyers guide.

The guide highlights lawyers who "bring remarkable skills in financing, structuring, litigating and creating a pathway forward." Honorees were selected through submissions, journalistic research and editorial vetting from a board of peers and clients.

Holland & Hart's Bankruptcy, Restructuring, and Creditors' Rights practice encompassing virtually everything that may flow from financial distress faced by our clients or those they deal with. Our lawyers have extensive experience in all phases of bankruptcy and insolvency. Among the many things we do is bankruptcy litigation, including avoidance actions, stay relief, adequate protection, plan confirmation, dischargeability, dismissal/conversion, and claim disputes, as well as contract and commercial litigation in the bankruptcy context.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Holland & Hart: Paul Swanson Discusses Antitrust Laws in the Gaming Industry Following Epic Games' Lawsuit Against Apple and Google

Holland & Hart antitrust and litigation attorney Paul Swanson shares insights with several media outlets into the review and decisions around antitrust violations in the gaming industry following Epic Games' lawsuit against Apple and Google. He provides a practitioner's perspective by calling the latest decision that Apple could not block Epic Games from accessing its developer tools, "a 'reasonable middle course' that reserves the status quo while saving bigger issues around anticompetitive business practices for 'another day.'"

Source: Company Website

July 29: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Advises Vaporsens in its Acquisition by Gentex Corporation

Holland & Hart represented Vaporsens, Inc. (Vaporsens), a Utah-based technology company specializing in nanofiber chemical sensing research and development, in its recent acquisition by Gentex Corporation (Gentex). Gentex purchased all of Vaporsens' stock for $10.5 million, which was in addition to its previous $3 million equity investment in Vaporsens. Gentex is a technology company, proficient in a wide range of core competencies that yield a unique fusion of technologies. The transaction closed on April 8, 2020.

Gentex funded the acquisition with $7.1 million in cash payments, with the remaining $3.4 million of consideration paid with restricted common stock of Gentex. The acquisition of Vaporsens will enable Gentex to complement and expand its product offerings.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised Vaporsens on the transaction, led by partner Jeff Steele with assistance from core team members associate Scott Baird and summer clerk Rossetti Farrell. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from Nathan Archibald, Sanna Deerrose, Shaun Kennedy, Mark Langer, John Ludlum, Sara Shelly, Lindsay Silber, and Trent Timmons.

Source: Company Website

July 23: Holland & Hart: Denver-area attorneys see uptick in design patent infringement

With businesses pivoting to sell more online, counterfeiters are better able to push fake products. That's where design patent protection can help.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Holland & Hart: Holland & Hart Advises Innergex Renewable Energy in its Acquisition of Six Idaho Wind Farms

Holland & Hart represented Innergex Renewable Energy Inc. ("Innergex") in its acquisition of the sponsor interest in a portfolio of six operating wind farms in Elmore County, Idaho (the "Mountain Air Acquisition") for a purchase price of $56.8 million from Terna Energy SA. The portfolio's tax equity partner is insurer MetLife. Innergex is an independent renewable power producer that develops, acquires, owns, and operates hydroelectric facilities, wind farms, and solar farms in Canada, the United States, France, and Chile.

The Mountain Air Acquisition comprises six 23 MW wind farms-Cold Springs, Desert Meadow, Hammett Hill, Mainline, Ryegrass, and Two Ponds-with a total installed capacity of 138 MW and is expected to produce a gross estimated long-term average of 331  GWh per year. The six wind farms have power purchase agreements with Idaho Power Company. This strategic acquisition further expands Innergex's portfolio in the U.S.

Holland & Hart's transactional team was led by Billi McCullough and Linda Jones and included Nneka Obiokoye, Adam Cohen, Arthur Hundhausen, Alison Hunter, Amy Lovin, Thor Nelson, Austin Rueschhoff, and Hilary Vaughn.

Holland & Hart's renewable energy team leverages decades of power industry experience to help clients seize opportunities to produce, develop, generate, and move electric power. We counsel clients on complex transactions and projects generating energy through solar, wind, geothermal, hydroelectric, and biofuels, as well as energy storage.

Source: Company Website

July 14: Holland & Hart: Public Hearing Begins Into "Unusual" Investigation Of Pacificorp's Energy Roadmap

The Wyoming Public Service Commission (PSC) has begun a week-long hearing regarding its investigation into a western utility's 20-year Integrated Resource Plan (IRP) released in October, 2019.

The preferred portfolio would retire several coal plant units in Wyoming along with New Mexico and Montana. It would then develop significant solar, wind, and battery storage resources throughout the region.

Source: Company Website

June 26: Holland & Hart: PG&E launches $5.2B in public offerings, targets July bankruptcy exit following judge's order

Update: June 26, 2020: PG&E announced June 26 that it has priced the public offering of 423,372,629 shares of its common stock at $9.50 per share and 14,545,455 of its equity units at $100 per unit "for total net proceeds to the Corporation, before estimated offering expenses, of approximately $3.968 billion and approximately $1.186 billion, respectively." PG&E said the offerings are expected to close on July 1, subject to certain conditions, the same date it expects to emerge from Chapter 11.

Source: Company Website

June 26: Holland & Hart Recognized for High-Quality Patent Scores at the USPTO by Patent Bots

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce it has been recognized as a top-ranking firm in the 2020 Patent Bots Quality Scores report. The report is a listing of law firms with at least 50 issued patents for the year ending March 31, 2020.

During the reporting year, Holland & Hart ranked 5th out of 284 firms in the Patent Bots Quality Scores for USPTO Tech Center 2800 (Semiconductors/Memory, Circuits/Measuring and Testing, Optics/Photocopying, Printing/Measuring and Testing), with an average score of 96.98 across 164 issued patents. The firm also ranked 7th out of 163 firms in the Patent Bots Quality Scores for USPTO Tech Center 2400 (Networking, Multiplexing, Cable, and Security), with an average score of 94.88 out of 278 issued patents.

Scores are calculated using an automated patent proofreading process that counts the number of errors in each issued patent downloaded from the USPTO for the year. Although the precise error counts in any individual patent may not be accurate, the average number of errors across all of a firm's patents is an excellent indicator of the quality of a firm's work.

Holland & Hart's team of 60+ patent attorneys, agents, and engineers provide strategic advice on high-value, high-volume patent portfolio development, counselling, and opinion matters for clients with large portfolios and/or complex technology or processes, drawing on our legal, practical, and technical experience. Our patent practice primarily focuses on next-gen technologies, including electrical engineering, wireless communications, computer technologies, software, semiconductors, physics, mechanical engineering, robotics, complex medical devices, chemical engineering, biotech, pharmaceutical, and other life sciences technologies.

Source: Company Website

June 23: Ten Holland & Hart Attorneys Recognized as 2020 IP Stars by Managing Intellectual Property

Managing Intellectual Property, an annual guide ranking the world's leading IP firms and practitioners, has recognized ten IP attorneys as 2020 IP STARS as well as the firm's IP practice nationally in the U.S. for trademark prosecution. Holland & Hart's IP practice was also ranked as highly recommended in Colorado and recommended in Idaho, Montana, and Utah.

Source: Company Website

June 05: Holland & Hart: Deep Space Systems Finalizes Acquisition by AE Industrial Partners

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based aerospace firm Deep Space Systems, Inc. (DSS) in connection with its acquisition by private equity firm AE Industrial Partners, LP (AEI). DSS is a leader in space systems engineering supporting the design, development, integration, testing, and operations of science, technology, and exploration spacecraft. AEI specializes in aerospace, defense & government services, power generation, and specialty industrial markets. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

The transaction will enable AEI to combine DSS with Adcole Space to form Redwire, a next- generation space technology platform focused on designing and developing mission critical systems and high reliability electronics in support of innovative space architecture. Redwire will combine the capabilities of both DSS and Adcole Space to form a unique and exciting participant in the rapidly growing space industry.

Holland & Hart's M&A was led by attorneys Shaun Kennedy and Amos Barclay, with assistance from core team members Paige Coriden, Peter Perla, and Trent Timmons. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from 11 other attorneys and professionals. Source: Company Website

April 07: Holland & Hart Represents Destination Pet in its Acquisition of VitalPet

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based Destination Pet, a leading pet healthcare and services company, in connection with its acquisition of Veterinary Care Inc. (d/b/a "VitalPet"), through an auction in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Houston, Texas. VitalPet is a group of 24 high-quality veterinary hospitals operating across seven states spanning from Texas to New York, specializing in providing best-in-class veterinary medicine to local communities.

The acquisition expands Destination Pet's footprint and enhances its network of high-quality veterinary care and integrated extending services that are focused on the total health and wellbeing of the pet.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised Destination Pet on the transaction, led by attorneys Gabe Hamilton and Claire Rosston, with assistance from core team members Steve Clayton, Craig Dammeier, Daniel Free, Chris Groll, A.J. Martinez, and Grace Witsil. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from 20 other attorneys and professionals.

Source: Company Website

March 26: Holland & Hart: Alaska Governor Appoints Sean Parnell to the Alaska Economic Stabilization Team

Holland & Hart Of Counsel Sean Parnell was appointed to the Alaska Economic Stabilization Team (AEST) by Alaska Governor Mike Dunleavy. Sean Parnell and former US Senator Mark Begich are leading a bipartisan, non-political effort to better protect the state's economy from the impact of the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Alaska. The team is reaching out to businesses and communities in all economic sectors to gain information and devise strategies to address economic stabilization. That information is being passed to the Office of the Governor and will be informing the governor's and legislators' decisions in the days and weeks ahead.

AEST is innovating in a virtual team environment connecting via video conference and teleconference and creating a hub and spoke concept for Alaskans to communicate more information to decisionmakers. Each Alaskan becomes a "hub" and reaches out to their contacts in their own business sector to gain information and strategies for decision-makers to consider. The hub passes information directly to Sean Parnell and Mark Begich who compile the information, strategically connect dots with existing policy initiatives at the state, federal, and local levels, and convey that information to the attention of decision-makers. AEST is working closely with the Office of the Governor and legislators, and is augmenting the state's comprehensive response to COVID-19.

Sean Parnell leverages more than 30 years of public service and legal expertise serving the business, regulatory, and infrastructure development needs of the companies that drive Alaska's economy. During his years of service as Alaska's Governor, Lieutenant Governor, and as a state Senator and Representative, as well as the Deputy Director of the Department of Natural Resources, Division of Oil and Gas, Sean developed a thorough understanding of all aspects of commercial development in Alaska.

March 25: Holland & Hart: Matt Harvey Honored as one of Idaho Business Review's 2020 Accomplished Under 40

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce Matt Harvey, an associate in the firm's Boise office, has been selected as one of Idaho Business Review's 2020 Accomplished Under 40 honorees. The program recognizes business professionals under the age of 40 for their leadership, professional accomplishments, community support, and vision/meeting goals. The honorees come from diverse backgrounds and industries, including business, healthcare, law, nonprofit work, government, and academia. Matt was recognized for his work growing and leading a local team of patent professionals to serve both local and global clients.

Matt is a registered patent attorney and focuses on patent prosecution, patent analysis, and intellectual property due diligence matters across electrical engineering and other computer-related fields, including standards-essential technologies. Prior to joining Holland & Hart, Matt practiced as a litigator with an international law firm in Denver and as a patent agent in Silicon Valley. He also worked as an electrical engineer for the U.S. Department of Energy at Sandia National Laboratories and as a graduate researcher in the Wireless Sensing Lab at the University of Washington.

Source: Company Website

March 17: Holland & Hart Launches Coronavirus Resource Site

Holland & Hart's Coronavirus Task Force, a multidisciplinary team of experienced practitioners across the firm, developed a Coronavirus Resource Site that offers practical guidelines and proactive solutions to help companies protect their business interests and their greatest asset - their workforce. The Resource Site includes insights and other informational resources to identify questions and address challenges so businesses can manage the legal, human, and safety threats of COVID-19.

Source: Company Website

February 20: Holland & Hart : EnergyIQ Finalizes Strategic Acquisition by Quorum Driving Workflow Automation

Holland & Hart represented Colorado-based EnergyIQ, LLC (EnergyIQ), a leading provider of well master data management software applications, in connection with its acquisition by Quorum Software (Quorum), the leader in digital transformation for the oil and gas industry. The acquisition expands and strengthens Quorum's industry-leading oil and gas software and services portfolio with EnergyIQ's leading well lifecycle data management for upstream exploration and production (E&P) companies. Financial details of the acquisition were not disclosed.

Holland & Hart's M&A team advised EnergyIQ on the transaction, led by partner Sue Oakes, with assistance from M&A associates Ryan Nichols and Nate Davis and paralegal Sara Shelly. The team also included subject matter expertise and support from Hector Beason, Sanna Deerrose, Daniel Free, Ben Gibbons, Dave Glynn, Peter Perla, Kevin Selzer, Lindsay Silber, and Trent Timmons, among others.

Source: Company Website

February 03: Holland & Hart: Kate Bradshaw Honored as one of Utah Business Magazine's Forty Under 40

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce Kate Bradshaw, Director of Government Affairs in the firm's Salt Lake City office, has been selected as one of Utah Business Magazine's Forty Under 40 honorees. The program recognizes business professionals under the age of 40 for their business success in one or more of the following categories: demonstrating exceptional leadership qualities; an innovator creating a disrupted technology who is making a major impact in an industry or market; or an entrepreneur who has created a new market or industry for a product with a high level of success.

Kate is an influential and effective lobbyist in Utah. As Director of Government Affairs at Holland & Hart, she leads the firm's government affairs programs in eight western states and represents clients before the Utah State Legislature, Governor and Executive branch agencies, and local jurisdictions. Kate develops comprehensive legislative and public relations strategies, including community outreach, and advises on key legislative, PAC, and campaign donation strategies.

Kate is known for taking on challenging legislative topics. Just one example is the Responsible Beer Choice Coalition, where she crafted and led the grassroots and political lobbying effort to persuade the State Legislature to increase the alcohol content of beer sold in retail outlets in Utah from 3.2 to 4.0% alcohol by weight, representing the biggest change in Utah alcohol content laws in 86 years.

In addition to serving as Director of Government Affairs, Kate has held multiple leadership roles, including serving as Councilwoman to the City of Bountiful since 2018, chairing the Westminster College Alumni Board, forming the Utah Business Coalition in 2014 and serving as co-chair since 2017, and serving as precinct chair for Bountiful Precinct 9.

Kate will be honored at the Utah Business Forty Under 40 celebration on February 20.

January 09: Holland & Hart: Micro Gaming Technologies Finalizes Strategic Acquisition by Everi Expanding Loyalty and Marketing Technology

Holland & Hart represented Las Vegas-based Micro Gaming Technologies Inc. (MGT), a privately-owned provider of self-service casino loyalty and marketing products and promotional tools and apps, in connection with the acquisition of certain MGT strategic assets by Everi Payments Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Everi Holdings Inc., a premier single-source provider of gaming products, financial technology, and player loyalty solutions in the gaming industry. The acquisition enables Everi to enhance its loyalty and marketing products by expanding its FinTech products and services portfolio.

Reno partner David Garcia led Holland & Hart's M&A team advising MGT on the transaction, which included Lori Argall, Adam Cohen, law clerk Dmetri Culkar, Sanna Deerrose, John Ludlum, Christopher Myers, Lindsay Silber, Trent Timmons, and Elliot Weiss, among others.

Source: Company Website

January 03: Holland & Hart Receives Pro Bono Award by Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada

Holland & Hart is proud to announce it received the 2019 Lied Award for most pro bono hours donated by a law firm by Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada. Lied Awards are given in recognition of the Lied Foundation Trust, recognizing firms and individuals who excelled in their pro bono efforts. The award was presented at the 19th Annual Pro Bono Awards ceremony in December.

The firm's Las Vegas office was recognized for donating more than 1500 hours of pro bono legal services over the past year to individuals, non-profits, and other Nevada organizations, including providing counsel to the Volunteers in Medicine of Southern Nevada free clinic; Children's Attorneys Project, that offers advice and representation to abused and neglected foster care children; immigration cases; consumer cases; and participating in the Ask-A-Lawyer program and counseling, to name a few.

Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada commented online that Holland & Hart "consistently makes pro bono an integral part of their culture and identity." They added on Facebook, [b]ased on the number of attorneys in this office, this firm far exceeded Nevada's aspirational goal of 20 pro bono hours per attorney, per year. Holland & Hart is well deserving of the 2019 Lied Award for Most Pro Bono Hours by a Law Firm."

The following attorneys in the firm's Las Vegas office were included in the 100 Hours Club, for providing more than 100 hours of pro bono legal services throughout the past year:

Connie Akridge, partner - healthcare Gian Brown, partner - corporate Robert Cassity, partner - commercial litigation Sydney Gambee, associate - commercial litigation Christopher Myers, associate - corporate Michael Wadley, associate - real estate and construction

The following Las Vegas attorneys were included in the 50 Hours Club listing, for their commitment of providing more than 50 hours of pro bono legal services over the past year:

Matthew Cecil, of counsel - labor and employment Lars Evensen, partner - construction and bankruptcy Amber Lunn, associate - real estate and construction Jessica Whelan, associate - commercial litigation

Additionally, ten attorneys in the firm's Las Vegas office were recognized in the Honor Roll listing for accepting a new pro bono case, having an open pro bono case, mentored on a pro bono case, or reported hours on a colleague's pro bono case.

The Legal Aid Center of Southern Nevada is a nonprofit law firm dedicated to providing direct legal representation, counsel and advice and community legal education to those who cannot afford an attorney.

January 01: Fifteen Attorneys Elected to Holland & Hart's Partnership

Holland & Hart LLP is pleased to announce that fifteen attorneys have been elected into the firm's partnership, effective Jan. 1. The newly elected partners serve clients in a range of practice areas and industries and work from several offices in the firm's footprint that includes eight states and Washington, D.C.

"Each of our new partners has achieved a level of preeminence in their practice areas to earn the trust and respect of clients," said Chris Balch, firm chair. "They have each demonstrated a commitment to the firm's core values, including teamwork, innovation, excellence, and diversity and inclusion that are critical to the firm's continued success " added Balch. Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2020

September 08: Holland & Hart: Joe Ramirez Elected Fellow of American College of Coverage Counsel

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce that Joe Ramirez, partner in the firm's Denver office, has been elected as a Fellow in the American College of Coverage Counsel (ACCC) by the ACCC Board of Regents. Established in 2012, the ACCC is a professional association comprised of U.S. and Canadian experienced and recognized lawyers in coverage and extracontractual matters who represent insurers and policyholders, and Honorary members from academia. Fellows are distinguished for their skill, experience, and high standards of professional and ethical conduct in the practice of insurance coverage and extracontractual law, and who are dedicated to excellence in this area of practice.

"We congratulate Joe on his fellowship in the American College of Coverage Counsel. We are proud of his accomplishments as a leader in insurance coverage law that earned him this well-deserved recognition," said Matt Smith, the firm's Commercial Litigation Practice Group Leader.

The ACCC focuses on educating all sectors involved in the field of insurance law - including the judiciary, legal and insurance professionals, law students and businesses - on cutting edge, emerging, and critical issues such as developing trends in insurance law and bad faith, trial practice and alternative dispute resolution, policy formation and claims handling.

Recognized as a leading insurance coverage lawyer, Joe provides clear strategies to his clients when they are faced with risk management and insurance coverage issues.

September 04: Holland & Hart: Google could face antitrust charges from Justice Department this month

An antitrust case against Google is coming as soon as this month.

Justice Department officials have pressured attorneys working on the case to wrap things up quickly so that an action can be brought against Alphabet Inc. GOOGL, -3.64% GOOG, -3.68%, the parent company of Google and YouTube, multiple sources told the New York Times on Thursday. MarketWatch was able to independently confirm the timing of the antitrust action.

A Justice Department spokeswoman declined to comment on the Times report. A company spokesman said Google would "continue to engage with ongoing investigations" and that its business practices enabled "increased choice and competition."

Google shares were flat in after-hours trading on Thursday.

The reasoning behind a rush to action underscores a belief among some antitrust experts that the Trump administration is seeking punitive measures against Big Tech for its influence over consumers and multiple markets to curry favor with voters. Anger toward the largest tech companies has resonated across political parties, from liberals to conservatives.

But some questioned the swift timetable, which could ultimately wreak havoc on a stock market driven by tech companies.

Holland & Hart is pleased to announce that Joe Ramirez, partner in the firm's Denver office, has been elected as a Fellow in the American College of Coverage Counsel (ACCC) by the ACCC Board of Regents. Established in 2012, the ACCC is a professional association comprised of U.S. and Canadian experienced and recognized lawyers in coverage and extracontractual matters who represent insurers and policyholders, and Honorary members from academia. Fellows are distinguished for their skill, experience, and high standards of professional and ethical conduct in the practice of insurance coverage and extracontractual law, and who are dedicated to excellence in this area of practice.

"We congratulate Joe on his fellowship in the American College of Coverage Counsel. We are proud of his accomplishments as a leader in insurance coverage law that earned him this well-deserved recognition," said Matt Smith, the firm's Commercial Litigation Practice Group Leader.

The ACCC focuses on educating all sectors involved in the field of insurance law - including the judiciary, legal and insurance professionals, law students and businesses - on cutting edge, emerging, and critical issues such as developing trends in insurance law and bad faith, trial practice and alternative dispute resolution, policy formation and claims handling.

Recognized as a leading insurance coverage lawyer, Joe provides clear strategies to his clients when they are faced with risk management and insurance coverage issues. He represents policyholders exclusively in a variety of insurance coverage cases. In addition, Joe consults business professionals on risk management issues, including maximizing the possibility of insurance coverage by examining existing exposures.
